title: Font on the DVD Cover of 'In Bruges'
content:
Hi there, just wondering if anyone can help me identify the font used for the ’In Bruges’ DVD Cover. I’m looking to find out what font is used for the (it’s in Belgium) piece of text which is in the bottom right hand corner of the following image.

[http://www.moviewallpapers.net/images/wallpapers/2008/in-bruges/in-bruge...](http://web.archive.org/web/20081209030543/http:/www.moviewallpapers.net/images/wallpapers/2008/in-bruges/in-bruges-3-800.jpg "http://www.moviewallpapers.net/images/wallpapers/2008/in-bruges/in-bruges-3-800.jpg")

Much appreciated.

 [‹ Aaargh, what am I looking at?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081209030543/http:/typophile.com/node/52461 "Go to previous forum topic") [WHAT FONT IS THIS? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081209030543/http:/typophile.com/node/52459 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Welshy

comments.content: Dunno, but it’s close to [Marydale](http://web.archive.org/web/20081209030543/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/3ip/marydale/?refby=typographica). See also these [handwriting fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20081209030543/http:/fontfeed.com/archives/contemporary-handwriting-fonts/).
Pretty sure it’s hand written (note different “i”s and the “gi” ligature).

You can get pretty close with [Angelina](http://web.archive.org/web/20081209030543/http:/www.dafont.com/font.php?file=angelina&page=1&nb_ppp_old=10&text=it's+in+Belgium&nb_ppp=10&psize=m&classt=alpha).
